programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund becomes jealous of the adulation that a boastful Sir Walter Raleigh has been receiving in court since his return from the New World. Attempting to impress the queen, he announces his intention to go on a voyage around the Cape of Good Hope, but his choice of captain leaves a lot to be desired. Comedy, guest starring Tom Baker and Simon Jones, with Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A round-up of all the day's main news stories from the UK and around the world.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town reaches a conclusion after a multitude of twist and turns, countless red herrings and numerous suspects with shaky alibis. In the last-ever episode the truth is finally revealed as detectives Alec Hardy and Ellie Miller finally untangle the web of deceit surrounding the rape of Trish Winterman. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue working on getting the second-hand Mercedes 230E back on the road.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton helps a Texan millionaire who wants to collect memorabilia from the Battle of Normandy. He visits farmhouses and museums to find rare items like a 1942 Luger.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Sr calls in to a radio show Mikey is guesting on, escalating the family feud, and Paul Jr sets up a bike shop in direct competition with his father.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Turbulence could spell disaster for Mike Kennedy. A second crack at a $3million Citation V offers Ken Cage and Danny Thompson a shot at redemption.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe is chased by a pack of police bloodhounds in training. He then helps combat invasive species of non-native plants in the Florida Everglades.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The materials, development and manufacturing processes behind the creation of champagne, ATMs and marine turbochargers.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How sharpening steels, bladder pumps, ironing boards and kayak paddles are made.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: The shocking discovery of 80-year-old Lea Adri-Soejoko's body in an allotment shed unraveled a tragic story. Detectives and her family recount the steps that led to her murder.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of the Agofsky brothers, who abducted a banker from his home and forced him to open the vault at his workplace before throwing him off a bridge. It took the FBI five years to gather enough evidence to convict them.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: As Hurricane Rita destroyed huge areas of Texas, the SPCA officers worked around the clock to organise a huge animal rescue operation.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown meets Harriet, a bearded dragon with a strange lump on its leg, as he continues to work at Kyabram Vet Clinic in Victoria.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Liza returns to the salon to top her dress with two skirts she has designed. Leanne purchases a cheap gown without conviction, and Ivania arrives with her opinionated fiance.
